inkball

Class Wall

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.Tile
      • inkball.Wall

  • public class Wall
extends Tile
    This is the child class of Tile. It is responsible for modifying its own attributes. Methods added to implement the extension, Bricks.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class inkball.Tile

        x, y

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wall

        public Wall(int x,
            int y,
            int colour)
        Constructor for Wall object. HP is set to default at 4, to allow for 3 hits/damage before it reaches 0 and is removed.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the Wall, in units of 1 Cell size(=32)
        y - The y-coordinate of the Wall, in units of 1 Cell size, and only relative to the game board instead of app window.
        colour - The colour of the Wall, represented by an integer. 0 = grey, 1 = orange, 2 = blue, 3 = green, 4 = yellow.
        Note: This method assumes that the colour given follows the colour dictionary of Inkball.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(App app)
        Specified by:
        draw in class Tile

      • getColour

        public int getColour()

      • getHP

        public int getHP()

      • damage

        public void damage(Ball ball)
        Reduces the HP attribute value by 1 when:
        - The Wall colour is grey;
        - The Ball and Wall are the same colour.
        Parameters:
        ball - The Ball object that is colliding with the Wall object.

      • colourToString

        public java.lang.String colourToString()
        This returns a string representation for the colour of the Wall object.
        Returns:
        String representing the colour of the Wall object, which is represented by an integer:
        0 = grey, 1 = orange, 2 = blue, 3 = green, 4 = yellow.
        Note: If the Wall object has a colour attribute that is not within the range, this method will return "grey" by default.
